title: City tycoon Michael Spencer nears deal to buy stake in the Tote
text:
Tory billionaire Michael Spencer is on track to buy a minority stake in the owner of one of Britain's most prominent gambling businesses.

The City tycoon is closing in on a deal for a portion of the parent company of the Tote after the bookmaker was sold by Betfred, the gambling empire owned by billionaire Fred Done.

Spencer’s bet on the Tote would add the former Conservative party treasurer to a roster of high profile investors in the business.

The Tote’s other financiers include the Queen’s racehorse manager John Warren and the granddaughter of Sir Winston Churchill.
